Package client.component

Class PieceAdapter

java.lang.Object
java.awt.event.MouseAdapter
client.component.PieceAdapter
All Implemented Interfaces:
MouseListener, MouseMotionListener, MouseWheelListener, EventListener
public class PieceAdapter extends MouseAdapter
A mouse adapter that listens on chess pieces. This listener handles the modification of the highlightedTiles parameter of its parent PiecePane. The combination of mouse listener methods supoprted by this class allow for piece click, drag, and placement.

  • Method Details

    • mousePressed

      public void mousePressed(MouseEvent e)
      Invoked when a mouse button has been pressed on a component. Determines and highlights the tiles containing the legal end positions of the pressed piece.
      Specified by:
      mousePressed in interface MouseListener
      Overrides:
      mousePressed in class MouseAdapter

    • mouseDragged

      public void mouseDragged(MouseEvent e)
      Invoked when a mouse button is pressed on a component and then dragged. MOUSE_DRAGGED events will continue to be delivered to the component where the drag originated until the mouse button is released (regardless of whether the mouse position is within the bounds of the component).

      As the component is dragged, its position is continuously updated to that of the cursor.

      Specified by:
      mouseDragged in interface MouseMotionListener
      Overrides:
      mouseDragged in class MouseAdapter

    • mouseReleased

      public void mouseReleased(MouseEvent e)
      Invoked when a mouse button has been released on a component. Once released, the start and end positions of the move made (as determined by the drag-path of the piece) are sent to the PiecePane reference held by this PieceAdapter.
      Specified by:
      mouseReleased in interface MouseListener
      Overrides:
      mouseReleased in class MouseAdapter
